SEARCH
Package edu.bu.labs.routing.agents

Class MazeAgent

java.lang.Object
edu.bu.labs.routing.agents.Agent
edu.bu.labs.routing.agents.MazeAgent
public abstract class MazeAgent extends Agent
The base type for Agent's that solve mazes in Sepia. MazeAgents implement a specific state machine that allows them to move from one coordinate on the map to another using a precomputed plan (i.e. a path). Agents in Sepia must override a few abstract methods, most notably initialStep, middleStep, and terminalStep. All of these methods are handled for you, to both control the API (and prevent you from issuing Sepia compound actions) as well as provide an API for the autograders to use. In this assignment, you will need to implement two methods: public Path search(Coordinate src, Coordinate goal, StateView state). This method is called by MazeAgent to calculate the path (called a plan) from the source Coordinate to the goal Coordinate. Note that the goal Coordinate is occupied (by the enemy base), and therefore your plan should not ultimately contain this vertex in it. public boolean shouldReplacePlan(StateView state) This method is called by MazeAgent to decide if the current plan is no longer valid (for instance if the current plan is blocked by an enemy unit or something). If this method returns true, then MazeAgent will call the search method again to calculate a new plan, which it will then follow. Here is a description of how these three methods are implemented: initialStep: This method discovers the unit you control, the enemy base's unit, and all other enemy units present on the map. Once this is complete, this method calls the search method to find a plan from your unit's current location to the location of the enemy's base. The path produced by this method is converted into a Stack of coordinates for internal use. middleStep: This method first calls the shouldReplacePlan method to determine if the current plan is still valid. If shouldReplacePlan returns true, then this method will call search, convert the result to a Stack of coordinates, and overwrite the current plan with this new plan. This method will then examine the current position of the unit you control. If the current plan is not empty, this method will try to move the unit to the next position in the current plan, and will fail if the coordinate to move to is not adjacent to the current position of the unit you control. When the plan is exhausted (i.e. there are no more coordinates in the Stack), this unit will try to attack the enemy base. If the unit you control is not adjacent to the enemy base, this method will crash the program. terminalStep: This method prints out the results of the game. There are four possible outcomes: 1) both your unit and the enemy base are killed. This is a tie. 2) the enemy base is killed and you survive. You win. 3) the enemy base survives and your unit is killed. You lose. 4) both the enemy base as well as you survive. This is a tie.
Author:
Andrew Wood

      protected void setCurrentPlan(Stack<Coordinate> newPlan)

    • initializeFromState

      public void initializeFromState(State.StateView stateView)
      A method to discover all units on the map. There should be only one unit you control and an arbitrary number of additional units the enemy controls. This method, after discovering the ids of these units and setting fields, will call makePlan to find the plan from your unit's current location to the exit of the maze.
      Specified by:
      initializeFromState in class Agent
      Parameters:
      stateView - The initial state of the game.

    • assignActions

      public Map<Integer,Action> assignActions(State.StateView stateView)
      A method to decide what action the unit you control should do every turn. This method decides what to do using the following algorithm: 1) if the current plan is invalid (i.e. this.shouldReplacePlan(state) returns true), then the current plan is replaced by a new plan calculated by search (technically it goes through a separate method called makePlan. This additional method calls search and then converts the Path object to a Stack of coordinates. 2) If the plan is not empty and the unit you control is not currently at the Coordinate to move to, then move to that coordinate. This can fail if the two coordinates are not adjacent. 3) If the plan is empty, attack the enemy base. If the unit you control is not adjacent to the enemy base, this method will print an error and crash the program.
      Specified by:
      assignActions in class Agent
      Parameters:
      stateView - The current state of the game
      Returns:
      A mapping from every unit id under our control to an Action that we want that unit to do.

    • makePlan

      protected Stack<Coordinate> makePlan(State.StateView stateView)
      A method to make a new plan from the current state of the game. This method gets the coordinate of the unit you control as well as the coordinate of the enemy base, and then calls the search method, which produces a Path that will lead the unit you control to a coordinate adjacent to the enemy base. This method then creates a Stack of coordinates from this Path, which is used internally by middleStep to move the unit you control.
      Parameters:
      stateView - The current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The Stack of coordinates to follow, called a plan.

    • shouldReplacePlan

      public abstract boolean shouldReplacePlan(State.StateView stateView)
      An abstract method that decides whether the current plan is still worth following or if we need to calculate (and execute) a new plan instead. If there are no enemies on the map we never need to replan so you can return false. If you want to do the extra credit some processing will need to happen here.
      Parameters:
      stateView - The current state of the game
      Returns:
      true if a new plan should be calculated and followed and false otherwise.

    • search

      public abstract Path<Coordinate> search(Coordinate src, Coordinate goal, State.StateView stateView)
      An abstract method for a graph traversal algorithm that computes the path from the source coordinate to the goal coordinate using the Path datatype.
      Parameters:
      src - The source coordinate
      goal - The goal coordinate
      stateView - The current state of the game
      Returns:
      A Path object that implements a path from the source coordinate to the goal coordinate
